business.headline: Finance Minister Nirmala SItharaman introduces new Income Tax Bill in Lok SabhaFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the new Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha amid the huge uproar by the opposition MPs. The bill will now be referred to the Select Committee of Lok Sabha for further review.
New Income Tax Bill tabled in Lok Sabha, faces select panel reviewThe government, in a bid to simplify the present Income Tax Act, 1961, has introduced a new income tax bill in Parliament today.

Explained: Why are large-cap mutual funds back in demandWith small-cap and mid-cap stocks experiencing corrections, investors are moving towards large-cap funds, which are considered safer and more stable in volatile times.

Quality Power IPO: 10 things investors must know before subscribing Quality Power Electrical Equipments Limited offers high-voltage electrical equipment and solutions for grid connectivity and energy transition.

New Income Tax Bill: How will it make taxpayers' lives simpler?The new income tax bill would be almost half of the current law, as the existing Income Tax Act,1961 contained 880 pages when it came into existence.
Sensex gains 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayAs of 10:48 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.85 points at 76,644.93, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 137.75 points to 23,183.00.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as cooling inflation boosts market sentimentShare Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 163.21 points to 76,334.39, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.25 points to 23,091.50 as of 9:30 AM.

Ajax Engineering IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and latest GMPAjax Engineering IPO allotment status: The IPO price band was set at Rs 599 to Rs 629 per share. The minimum lot size for the application was 23 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required was Rs 13,777.

New Income Tax Bill to be tabled today: Here's what you can expectNew Income Tax Bill is expected to come into effect on April 1, 2026. The bill aims to simplify tax laws, remove outdated provisions, and make compliance easier for taxpayers.

Can a married couple save more taxes using both old and new tax regime?Married couples need to determine which tax regime offers lower tax liability for each spouse considering their income structure and deductions.

India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in January, hits a five-month lowThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices, according to data released by the National Statistics Office on Wednesday.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

After 90-hour workweek remark, L&T chief stirs work-from-home debateThis is not the first time that the L&T Chairman's remarks have sparked a debate.  Earlier, he advocated a 90-hour workweek, which drew huge criticism.

Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

L&T chief stirs fresh row with remark on labour crisis: Workers unwilling to moveSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Sensex falls 700 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged over 850 points before trimming some losses, trading 748.13 points lower at 75,545.47 by 10:23 am. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped nearly 1%, reflecting weakness across broader markets.
Sensex tumbles over 850 points as US tariff fears spook Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex nosedived 834.39 points to 75,459.21 at 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 251.95  points to trade at 22,819.85.

entertainment.headline: Olivia Swann on NCIS: Sydney, her character's growth & challenges In this exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Olivia Swann dives deep into her role in NCIS: Sydney, sharing insights into her character's journey, development, and challenges throughout the series.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

Jackson Wang makes a powerful comeback with High Alone from Magic Man 2Jackson Wang drops a new single, High Alone, that marks the beginning of his new album, MAGIC MAN 2. The album promises a deep dive into themes of identity and personal transformation, set against a backdrop of atmospheric production and introspective lyrics.

Actor John Lithgow approached to play Albus Dumbledore in Harry Potter seriesAward-winning American actor John Lithgow has reportedly been approached to play the iconic character of Hogwarts principal Albus Dumbledore in HBO's Harry Potter series.

Rupali Ganguly's stepdaughter calls her 'evil step lady', issues clarificationRupali Ganguly's stepdaughter, Esha Verma, clarified her viral social media post against the actor. Esha requested privacy.

Truth behind viral video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying over 'loss of work'Amid backlash over India's Got Latent, an old video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying resurfaces. In the video, the podcaster is seen breaking down over 'loss of work'.

Jonas Brothers hint at big change for 2025, shocked fans ask, 'another breakup?'The Jonas Brothers shared a letter on social media that briefly sent fans into a panic. In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

Kapil Sharma's 'Maa Baap ki Kabaddi' joke goes viral amid Ranveer Allahbadia rowAmid the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on Samay Raina's show India's Got Latent, an old clip of Kapil Sharma joking about kids watching "maa baap ki kabaddi" is going viral.

Watch: Did AR Rahman refer to Ranveer Allahbadia row at Chhaava music launch?AR Rahman made a humorous remark at the Chhaava music launch that has led to speculation about its connection to the recent controversy involving Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina.

Ed Sheeran's India dump features photo from football match with John AbrahamSinger Ed Sheeran shared his India dump, which also featured a glimpse of his football match with Bollywood actor John Abraham. Sheeran is in India for his Mathematics Tour.

Aly Goni feels Samay Raina was 'forced' to delete India's Got Latent episodesActor Aly Goni has commented on YouTuber-comedian Samay Raina's decision to remove episodes of India's Got Latent. Fans have also reacted to Samay's decision on social media.
Odia rapper Abhinav Singh, 32, dies by suicide in BengaluruA rapper from Odisha, Abhinav Singh, died in Bengaluru where he was working for a private company. He was 32.

Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show is the most-watchedRapper Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show has become the most-watched Super Bowl show of all time, garnering an impressive 133.5 million views.

Too much to handle: Samay Raina deletes all videos from his show amid jokes rowComedian Samay Raina finally broke his silence on the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's remark on his show, India's Got Latent. He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

Amy Adams joins Javier Bardem in Cape Fear TV adaptationAfter Javier Bardem, actor Amy Adams is on board for the much-awaited Cape Fear TV adaptation. The release date for the show has not been announced yet.

Kanye West dropped by talent agency amid antisemitic, controversial actionsKanye West's controversial actions have led to his talent agency, 33&West, dropping him. The decision follows a series of antisemitic remarks and troubling social media posts by the rapper that have sparked widespread condemnation.

Samay Raina's show in Gujarat cancelled amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina's Gujarat shows have been cancelled following a controversy sparked by the latest episode of his show, India's Got Latent. The decision comes amid backlash after a distasteful comment by YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia on the show.

Sakamoto Days: With ex-assassin's potential match, the anime is raising stakesSakamoto Days follows the story of a legendary assassin who transforms into a family man. Now, with the introduction of an equally formidable enemy, the anime might finally pick up pace and raise the stake.
Aashram 3 Part 2 teaser: Bobby Deol's comeback as Baba Nirala promises more twistsAashram 3 Part 2 teaser is out. The upcoming riveting crime drama marks the return of Bobby Deol as Bala Nirala.

Anupamaa actor Gaurav Khanna opens up on being colour-blind on Celebrity MasterchefTV actor Gaurav Khanna appeared on Celebrity MasterChef where he opened up about being colour-blind. He participated on the show along with Ayesha Jhulka.

general news.headline: Amid Waqf bill storm in Parliament, Amit Shah says no objection to dissent notes Live UpdatesOpposition MPs claimed that portions of dissent notes were removed from the report on the Waqf bill and resorted to sloganeering in Parliament, leading to adjournment of proceedings.
New Income Tax Bill tabled in Lok Sabha, faces select panel reviewThe government, in a bid to simplify the present Income Tax Act, 1961, has introduced a new income tax bill in Parliament today.

UN report exposes Yunus on attacks on Hindus in BangladeshA UN report on human rights violations and abuses has debunked Muhammad Yunus' claims of "exaggerated propaganda" by confirming widespread violence against Hindus, their temples and businesses in post-Hasina Bangladesh. The report, conducted on the invitation of Yunus' interim government, details incidents of targeted mob attacks and arson.

Kerala nursing college ragging video surfaces, shows victim tied, being torturedDisturbing footage from the Government Nursing College in Kottayam shows a junior student being tied up, stabbed with a compass, and tortured by seniors. Five third-year students were arrested after the victim and two others filed a police complaint detailing months of ragging.

IAF chief's lack of trust in HAL is alarming; PM and Defence Minister must step inTo be fair, this is not the first time that the IAF chief has flagged the delays in the delivery of the Tejas Light Combat Aircraft to the Indian Air Force.

Himanta Sarma jabs Congress's Gaurav Gogoi, wife over 'Pak link', MP hits backHimanta Sarma, in a spree of posts on X, has raised Gaurav Gogoi's meeting with then Pakistani High Commissioner in 2015 despite India's protest and alleged that the Congress MP's wife had ISI links.
15 injured after car drives into crowd in Germany's Munich: Report15 injured after car drives into group of people in Germany's Munich: News agency Reuters

Indian courts under pressure from Modi government? DY Chandrachud counters BBCFormer Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud maintained that despite external pressures, the Supreme Court continues to uphold personal liberties and the rule of law, ensuring that judicial independence remains the cornerstone of India's democracy.

Black warrant reality check: Is India skipping the noose?No capital punishment has been approved by the Supreme Court for a second year in a row in India. The last hangings in India were in 2020, when the Nirbhaya case convicts were executed. Though India hasn't officially scrapped capital punishment, despite repeated calls from several quarters, the Supreme Court, it seems, is exercising the utmost restraint when it comes to sending convicts to the gallows.

Beyond 8 glasses: How much water is too much water? Staying hydrated is essential, but how much water is too much or too little? Understanding the right balance is key to maintaining kidney health and overall well-being.

Kamal Haasan set for Rajya Sabha as DMK fulfills pact, Udhayanidhi visits him Actor Kamal Haasan is set to become a Rajya Sabha MP from the DMK's quota, as the ruling party fulfils its 2024 electoral pact. Udhayanidhi Stalin met Haasan at his residence to congratulate him.

We enjoy seeing successful people fail: Rapper Raftaar amid India's Got Latent rowRapper Raftaar, who's also friends with comedian Samay Raina, made a social media post about people who find joy in seeing others fail in life. He listed the reasons behind this human psyche, and urged people to do some self-assessment.

Aaditya Thackeray's 'traitor' jab at Eknath Shinde after Sharad Pawar's praiseAadtiya Thackeray's remarks came a day after NCP (SP) founder Sharad Pawar praised Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde for his work when he was the Chief Minister.

Man who helped save Rishabh Pant in 2022 takes poison with girlfriend, she diesWhile Rajat, 25, is currently battling for his life in a private hospital in Roorkee, his 21-year-old girlfriend Mannu died during treatment on Wednesday.

Employee claims CEO made latecomers wait outside office, Reddit post sparks debateThe incident, shared by Reddit user 'shutterspice' - an employee of the organisation - on r/IndianWorkplace, has drawn comparisons to school punishments as social media users discussed workplace culture and toxicity.

When listeners could download video games via radio in the 80sBefore Wi-Fi, radio was the 'download button'! You just had to tape the airwaves and download your game. Microcomputer games were commonly stored on audio cassettes, which made it possible to transmit them via radio broadcasts.

IPL 2025: Rajat Patidar named new RCB captain, Virat Kohli backs callRoyal Challengers Bengaluru decided to name Rajat Patidar as their new captain for the IPL 2025 season. Patidar became RCB's 8th captain in their IPL history and replaced Faf du Plessis.

Alien planet that can fit 263 Earths inside it discovered from IndiaThe planet, dubbed TOI-6038A b, is a dense sub-Saturn size with a mass of 78.5 Earth masses and a radius of 6.41 Earth radii in a wide binary system.

Watch: Leopard gatecrashes Lucknow wedding, frantic guest jumps off roofHundreds of guests ran out as the leopard strayed into the wedding venue. One person was seriously injured after jumping off the roof in panic.

Indian Army says ceasefire along LoC intact, denies reports of heavy firingThe Indian Army denied reports of heavy firing along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir and said the ceasefire is intact.

PM Modi to meet Trump: Why Isro will be closely following the visitBoth the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro) and the American space agency Nasa will have their eyes set on the key meeting in the White House.

Mammootty's Bramayugam becomes case study at UK film school for its sound designA student's Instagram story reveals that the Malayalam horror thriller Bramayugam is now part of the curriculum at the University for the Creative Arts, UK, with faculty analysing its sound design and comparing it to Harry Potter.

Ram Gopal Varma reveals how a famous director couldn't watch KGF 2 after 15 minutesDirector Ram Gopal Varma is often in the headlines for making bold statements. In a recent interview he revealed a conversation he had with another famous director who was not a fan of Yash's KGF 2.

Captain America Brave New World to Chhaava: Films releasing on Valentine's DayFrom the superhero film Captain America: Brave New World to the Indian period drama Chhaava and more, here's a list of films that are releasing on February 14, Valentine's Day.

Ajith Kumar redefines masculinity in Tamil cinema with strong anti-patriarchy standAjith Kumar, in his recent films, took an anti-patriarchy and anti-misogynistic stand. His latest film, Vidaamuyarchi, is an example.

sports.headline: Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi fined heavily for altercation during ODI tri-seriesShaheen Afridi was fined 25 percent of his match fee for making deliberate physical contact with Matthew Breetzke, while Saud Shakeel and Kamran Ghulam also faced penalties for aggressive celebrations during Pakistan's win over South Africa.

Jasprit Bumrah trains hard at NCA after being ruled out of Champions Trophy Star India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah shared a glimpse of his training at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru after being ruled out of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Rohit Sharma is selfless, he has led India's ODI transformation: R AshwinFormer India spinner R Ashwin said that India were late to embrace modern-day one-day international cricket, but Rohit Sharma, with his selfless approach, transformed the team's mindset in the 50-over format.

National Stadium KarachiChampions Trophy 2025 Venue: The National Stadium in Karachi, now revamped as the National Bank Cricket Arena, is set to host the ICC Champions Trophy opener, marking a historic return for Pakistan's cricketing fortress after an extensive renovation.

UP Warriorz will miss Alyssa Healy, but I'm not under pressure: Deepti WPL 2025: Skipper Deepti Sharma admitted that the UP Warriorz will miss Alyssa Healy, but also sounded confident of her team making strong comeback after failing to qualify for the final in the first two seasons.

Dubai International Cricket StadiumThe Dubai International Cricket Stadium, also known as the Ring Of Fire, will host all of India's matches during the Champions Trophy 2025 and also the semi-final. If India qualifies for the final, the match will be played in Dubai. The stadium has a capacity of 25,000.

Asia Team Championships: India lose 2-3 to Korea, but assured of quarters placeBadminton Asia Team Championships 2025: Men's singles player Sathish Kumar Karunakaran and the women's doubles pair of Gayatri Gopichand and Jolly Treesa helped India recover from 0-2 down, but they lost to South Korea 2-3 in the final group-stage tie. India booked their berth in the quarter-final.

Not pregnant: Healy clears air on Starc's Champions Trophy withdrawalMitchell Starc's wife and Australia women's team star, Alyssa Healy, has cleared the air regarding the pacer's decision to skip the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Starc had opted out of the tournament for personal reasons.

Kohli does not need captaincy to lead RCB: Bobat explains Patidar callRCB team director Mo Bobat assured that despite Rajat Patidar's captaincy appointment, Virat Kohli will continue to play a vital leadership role, offering invaluable experience and guidance to the team without needing the official title.

Virat Kohli's message to new RCB captain Rajat Patidar: You've earned thisVirat Kohli sent a heartfelt message to RCB's new captain Rajat Patidar and claimed that the MP batter earned the right to become the new skipper of the franchise. Patidar was announced as the new RCB captain on February 13.

India booked their berth in the quarter-final.

Liverpool's Slot, Jones shown red in chaotic Merseyside Derby vs EvertonLiverpool's Merseyside Derby against Everton ended in chaos with three red cards, a fiery brawl, and Arne Slot's ejection after a dramatic 2-2 draw, leaving tensions high despite Liverpool maintaining their Premier League lead.

Champions Trophy: Spencer Johnson hoping to replicate Mitchell Starc in PakistanChampions Trophy 2025: Australia's Spencer Johnson is hoping that he can replicate senior left-arm pacer Mitchell Starc's heroics during the upcoming Champions Trophy in Pakistan. Johnson has been picked as a replacement for Starc in the squad for the tournament.

RCB captaincy announcement Highlights: Rajat Patidar to lead in IPL 2025RCB captaincy announcement Highlights: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have taken a bold call to start a new chapter as they announced Rajat Patidar as their new skipper for the upcoming IPL 2025.

IPL 2025: Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar frontrunners for RCB captaincy roleIPLL 2025: Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar are frontrunners to be named as the new Royal Challengers Bengaluru skipper for the upcoming IPL 2025 season. Both men were retained by the franchise ahead of the new season.

Buttler backs England teammates after India loss, rejects 'unserious' claimsJos Buttler defended his England teammates after their 3-0 ODI series defeat to India, dismissing criticism from the likes of Kevin Pietersen and Ravi Shastri, who questioned England's training approach and preparation ahead of the Champions Trophy.

Dangerous Afghanistan set for bigger heights on debutChampions Trophy 2025: Hashmatullah Shahidi's Afghanistan might not be the outright favourites to win the tournament, but are more than capable to taking down of the big teams. Their campaign starts on February 21 against South Africa in Karachi.

No Champions Trophy warm-up matches for India, Australia and PakistanChampions Trophy 2025: India and Australia have opted out of Champions Trophy warm-ups, while Pakistan has scheduled three with their Shaheen squads. Rohit Sharma's squad will rely on their ODI series win over England as sufficient preparation for the tournament in Dubai.

Parthiv Patel explains why Harshit Rana is more effective with old ballIND vs ENG: Parthiv Patel said that Harshit Rana is a hit-the-deck bowler and hence, he gets more wickets with the old ball. Rana finished the top wicket-taker amongst pacers in the ODI series against England.

How Shreyas Iyer countered his short-ball weakness, reveals former batting coachFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has given his insights on how Shreyas Iyer countered his short-ball weakness in the recent ODI series against England.

Who said what as India beat England 3-0 before Champions Trophy IND vs ENG: Rohit Sharma was happy with India's outings in the ODIs against England. Jos Buttler, on the other, said that the Three Lions couldn't make use of the chances India gave them throughout the series.

Varun Chakravarthy could be our X factor for Champions Trophy: Gautam GambhirIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir feels wrist spinner Varun Chakravarthy could be the team's X factor in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Chakravarthy was the last minute addition to India's squad for the tournament as he replaced Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Pakistan storm into tri-series final with historic run-chase in KarachiPAK vs SA: Salman Ali Agha and Mohammad Rizwan scored twin centuries as Pakistan beat South Africa by six wickets to book their berth in the final of the ODI tri-series against New Zealand.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
